description: Erection of four storey rear extension with mansard roof extension to create additional commercial space for use classes A1, A2 and A3, at ground and part lower ground level; the change of use, reconfiguration and extension of the existing residential space to the upper floors to create ten residential units with six car parking spaces and twelve cycle spaces at the lower ground floor and three external car parking spaces (PART RETROSPECTIVE variation on P/2012/0817).
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposal contained in the application and the plans submitted therewith and numbered: Planning Statement 21 June 2017, Design and Access Statement (Rev D) March 2012, Structural Engineering and Inspection Report (DG/7571) January 2012 Updated: March 2012, Structural Report addendum (8515/L/RA) 14 August 2015, Economic Development Assessment (GB/MR/13387) 9 March 2012, Daylight & Sunlight to Neighbouring Residential Buildings (JC/FR/9548) 22 March 2012, Servicing and Waste Management Plan (Rev 2) 6 March 2012, Transport Statement (Rev 2) 6 Mach 2012, Location Plan (EWO.001), GA02 Rev O, GA05 Rev O, GA06 Rev J, GA08 Rev L, GA09 Rev L, GA10 Rev F, GA11 Rev M (Received 28/06/17), Drainage Assessment Form (Received 17/07/17), GA01 Rev K, GA03 Rev P, GA04 Rev P (Received 14/08/17), SAP Calculations Flats 1-10, 57-59 Kew Bridge Road (Received 15/08/17), GA13 Rev J (Received 02/09/17), GA07 Rev P (Received 15/09/17), XPDrainage Calculations (Received 18/09/17), Maintenance Procedures for Sustainable Drainage System, SUDs Routine Maintenance Record (Received 10/10/17), EPG/8736/SD/01 Rev A, Sustainable Urban Design Statement (Rev 2.0) October 2017 (Received 31/10/17).

Condition : 2 - Works to ensure that any part of the development that has not been built in accordance with the plans listed in Condition 2 shall be rectified and made good in accordance with these approved plans within 6 months of the date of this permission. No part of the development shall be occupied until such time that these works have been completed.

Condition : 3 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Friday and 8am to 4pm on Saturdays and not at all on Sundays and Public Holidays.

Condition : 4 - The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved under application reference 00657/57-59/P4(4-17) / P/2014/0023 dated 31/07/2014. Any works which form part of the scheme shall be completed before any part of the development is first occupied, and shall be maintained thereafter.

Condition : 5 - Any fixed external plant shown on the approved plans shall be designed and installed to ensure that noise emanating from such plant is at least 10dB below the background noise levels when measures from the nearest sensitive receptors. No further fans, louvres, ducts or other external plant shall be installed without the written prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved under application reference 00657/57-59/P4(4-17) / P/2014/0023 dated 31/07/2014. Any works which form part of the scheme shall be completed before any part of the development is first occupied, and shall be maintained thereafter.

Condition : 7 - Prior to the first occupation of any part of the development, the space for vehicle parking, turning, loading and unloading (including the vehicle turning circle) shall be provided in accordance with the parking layout as shown on drawings GA13 Rev J and GA01 Rev K. This shall include a minimum 20% 'active' Electric Vehicle Charging spaces (min 7kW) and 20% 'passive' Electric Vehicle Charging spaces (min 7kW). This area shall, thereafter, be kept available for parking and turning of motor cars and goods vehicles at all times.

Condition : 8 - Prior to the occupation of the commercial unit, a Delivery and Servicing Plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in consultation with Transport for London. This shall include a restriction that the size of delivery vehicles be no greater than 7.5T and that all servicing must be undertaken from the loading bay west of the site to prevent obstruction of the bus stop adjacent to the proposed development. The Delivery and Servicing Plan shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details for the lifetime of the development.

Condition : 9 - The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved under application reference 00657/57-59/P4(4-17) / P/2014/0023 dated 31/07/2014. Any works which form part of the scheme shall be completed before any part of the development is first occupied, and shall be maintained thereafter.

Condition : 10 - Prior to the first occupation of the commercial unit, the short-stay cycle parking (min. 5 spaces) and the long-stay staff cycle parking (min. 2 space) shall be provided in accordance with the approved plans. Such spaces shall be provided as Sheffield stands or similar. These spaces shall only be used for cycle parking and access shall be retained throughout the lifetime of the development.
Condition : 11 - No more than 150sq.m of the commercial floorspace within the development shall be used at any time for A3 uses.

Condition : 12 - Activities relating to the collection of refuse and recyclables and the tipping of empty bottles into external receptacles shall only take place between 07.00 and 23.00 Monday to Saturday and 09.00 and 20.00 on Sundays and Bank Holidays.

Condition : 13 - The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved under application reference 00657/57-59/P4(4-17) / P/2014/0023 dated 31/07/2014. Any works which form part of the scheme shall be completed before any part of the development is first occupied, and shall be maintained thereafter.

Condition : 14 - The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved under application reference 00657/57-59/P4(4-17) / P/2014/0023 dated 31/07/2014. Any works which form part of the scheme shall be completed before any part of the development is first occupied, and shall be maintained thereafter.

Condition : 15 - The waste and recycled materials storage arrangements shown on drawing GA13 Rev J shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied and maintained thereafter.

Condition : 16 - The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the details approved under application reference 00657/57-59/P4(4-17) / P/2014/0023 dated 31/07/2014. Any works which form part of the scheme shall be completed before any part of the development is first occupied, and shall be maintained thereafter.

Condition : 17 - Prior to the first occupation of any part of the development, the landowner shall enter into a Section 278 agreement with Transport for London to repair the footway along the site's boundary (inclusive 57-60 Kew Bridge Road) on Kew Bridge Road.

Condition : 18 - Prior to the occupation of any residential unit, the residential cycle storage shall be made available for use in accordance with the provision indicated on the approved plans (with a minimum of 14 spaces). This storage shall consist of a horizontal storage arrangement to ensure accessibility for all residents and where double stack arrangements, these shall be provided with a mechanical or pneumatic assisted lift (or such equivalent provision). The cycle store shall then be maintained as such thereafter and fully accessible to all residents.

Condition : 19 - Prior to first occupation of any part of the development, final detailed drainage designs (including drawings) of the proposed drainage scheme agreed within the Sustainable Drainage Design Statement written EPG (Oct 2017) and other previously submitted information and the following correspondence email dated the 26th October 2017, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such detailed drainage designs shall ensure the proposed developments discharge rate is restricted 1l/s.

Condition : 20 - Prior to first occupation of any part of the development, evidence that the drainage system has been built in accordance with the final detailed drainage designs (condition 19) through the submission of photographs and copies of installation contracts, and written confirmation that the drainage features will be managed as per the detailed maintenance plan for the lifetime of the development, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
